item.name: Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs Subcommittee

item.text: This bill provides for the payment of certain accrued benefits to the estate of a deceased veteran upon the veteran's death.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify that the estate of a deceased veteran may receive certain accrued benefits upon the death of the veteran, and for other purposes.
To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify that the estate of a deceased veteran may receive certain accrued benefits upon the death of the veteran, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 17 (Wednesday, February 1, 2017)][Pages H878-H879]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ZELDIN:H.R. 814.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.[[Page H879]]
bill.title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify that the estate of a deceased veteran may receive certain accrued benefits upon the death of the veteran, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Disability Assistance and Memorial Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
